docs.title: v1 Introduction
docs.text:
Caution

This project is deprecated. Visit SUAFT 120 for the latest design.

SUAFT is an activated carbon and HEPA filter for 3D printer enclosures.

docs.title: Goals
docs.text:
1. Be simple and efficient.
  2. Be easy to build.
  3. Be cheap to source.

docs.title: Bill of Materials
docs.text:
The filter can be printed with either one or two fans. The second fan can be used to provide additional airflow or act as a controlled chamber exhaust fan.

A method of mounting the filter to 2020 extrusions is coming soon.

Single Fan BOM

Dual Fan BOM

docs.title: Assembly
docs.text:
Print SUAFT with ASA, ABS, or PETG. If your enclosure regularly reaches 60C, ASA is recommended.

Heat Set Insert Locations

Assembly Guide

docs.title: Activated Carbon Filter
docs.text:
Step 1. Fill the filter with activated carbon until nearly overflowing.

Step 2. Place the cover over the filter. Secure with four (4) M3 x 6mm SHCS.

docs.title: Filter Body
docs.text:
Step 1. Fit the HEPA filter on to the cap. It should be a snug fit.

Step 2. Note the arrow in the bottom left corner. Align the arrows on the cap and main body while pressing them together.

Step 3. Secure the cap and main body with four (4) M3 x 6mm SHCS.

Step 4. Place your radial fan over the fan inlet. The airflow symbol should be directly under the fan. Secure with two (2) M3 x 35mm SHCS.

Step 5. Secure a filter to one side with four (4) M3 x 6mm SHCS.

Step 6. Repeat with the second filter and four (4) more M3 x 6mm SHCS.

docs.title: v2 Introduction
docs.text: SUAFT v2 is an activated carbon and HEPA filter for 3D printer enclosures. SUAFTs are designed to be simple, cheap, and efficient; v2 builds on v1 with a sleeker design and easier disassembly.

docs.title: Goals
docs.text:
1. Be simple and efficient.
  2. Be easy to build.
  3. Be cheap to source.

docs.title: Bill of Materials
docs.text:
The filter can be printed for single or dual fan operation. Use a single fan assembly for compact printers (200x200 bed or smaller) or ones with limited free space. High flow and larger volume printers should use dual fans.

Print your SUAFT in a material suitable for your enclosures maximum temperature:

  • CF-ASA, CF-ABS: >80C
  • ASA: >60C
  • ABS: >45C. Avoid with active heaters.
  • PETG: <45C or chamber floor. PETG filters should be considered a temporary solution (expected to fail with time). Do not use with active heaters.

docs.title: Materials
docs.text: Part Qty Radial 75mm x 30mm fan 2 ea Moosoo XL-618A HEPA Filter 1 ea M3 x 35mm SHCS 4 ea M3 x 6mm SHCS 10 ea 6mm x 3mm magnets 24 Heat set inserts, M3 x 5mm x 4mm 14 ea Acid-free coconut shell activated carbon < 0.5kg/1lb HEPA Top.stl 1 ea HEPA Bottom.stl 1 ea Fan Base.stl 2 ea Fan Lid.stl 2 ea AC Base - Solo.stl 1 ea AC Lid - Solo.stl 1 ea

docs.title: SUAFT 120 Introduction
docs.text: SUAFT 120 is an activated carbon and HEPA filter for 3D printer enclosures. SUAFTs are designed to be simple, cheap, and efficient; v3 builds on v1 with a sleeker design and easier disassembly.

docs.title: Goals
docs.text:
1. Be simple and efficient.
  2. Be easy to build.
  3. Be cheap to source.

docs.title: Bill of Materials
docs.text:
The filter can be printed for single or dual fan operation. A single fan should be used for continuous filtration. Dual fans can be used for large format printers or as an exhaust filter.

SUAFT 120 Bill of Materials

docs.title: Materials
docs.text:
Material choice is guided by enclosure operating temperature.

  • CF-ASA, CF-ABS: >80C, <95C
  • ASA: >60C
  • ABS: >45C. Avoid with active heaters.
  • PETG: <45C or chamber floor. PETG filters should be considered a temporary solution (expected to fail with time). Do not use with active heaters.

docs.title: Assembly
docs.text:
Preparation

Assembly

docs.title: Assembly
docs.text:
Step 1. Insert a HEPA filter into the center of the filter tank.

Step 2. Use a funnel to add activated carbon to the outer tank. Fill until the carbon covers the highlighted holes in the tank.

Step 3. Cover the filter tank with the lid. Secure with three (3) M3 x 6mm screws.

Step 4. Attach the base to the 120mm fan with three (3) M3 x 6mm screws.

Step 5. Snap the filter and base together. Your SUAFT 120 is now ready!

docs.title: Materials
docs.text: Part Qty Radial 120mm x 32mm fan 1 ea Moosoo XL-618A HEPA Filter 1 ea M3 x 6mm SHCS 6 ea 6mm x 3mm magnets 12 Heat set inserts, M3 x 5mm x 4mm 6 ea Acid-free coconut shell activated carbon < 0.5kg/1lb Base.stl 1 ea Filter Cap.stl 1 ea Filter.stl 1 ea Funnel.stl 1 ea, Optional

docs.title: Heat Set Inserts
docs.text:
Step 1. Install heat set inserts into three (3) of the four (4) highlighted holes in the fan. The fourth may be left unused.

Step 2. Install heat set inserts into the three (3) highlighted holes in the fitler cage.

docs.title: Magnet Installation
docs.text:
Step 1. Fix magnets into the six (6) highlighted locations. It is strongly recommended that the polarity of the magnets are all oriented the same direction.

Step 2. Fix magnets into the six (6) highlighted locations. These magnets must have the same orientation as the base magnets.

Step 3. Test that the filter and base snap together properly. Once any issues are fixed, optionally add a drop of super glue to the highlighted well area next to each magnet; this will help ensure magnets do not come loose.
